availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Warren Viley (Woodford County, Kentucky, solider)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, solider. Woodford County native. Son of Warren Viley and Catherine J. Martin Viley. Resident of Woodford County in 1850. Private in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (Confederate). Died of typhoid fever at Bowling Green, Kentucky on December 27, 1861.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District No. 1, p. 442B. Hall, Charles W.L., Ph.D., Revivals to Revolvers...To Die for Commonwealth and Family! A History of the Second Regiment Kentucky Infantry, CSA, (Bloomington, IN: Trafford Publishing, 2013), 184. Find A Grave, "John Warren Viley (1841-1861)," Memorial #98984130, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98984130/john-warren-viley (accessed January 16, 2018).
